headline: Tariffs and Policy Uncertainty Dampen 12-month Economic Outlook for U.S. Businesses
summary: DES MOINES, Iowa, September 03, 2025--U.S. business confidence remains near historic survey lows according to new Principal Financial Well-Being IndexSM research, despite a modest rebound from a post-pandemic low reported in April 2025. The Index climbed to 6.80 out of 10 in August, up from 6.02 in April, but remains far below the 8.08 recorded a year ago, as policy changes and new tariffs continue to dampen expectations for the year ahead.
